meanings.definition: The belief in the descent of all living organisms from a single pair of ancestors.
meanings.sent1: The concept of monogeny suggests that all life on Earth originated from just one pair of ancestors.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study monogeny to understand how different species may have evolved from a common source.
meanings.sent3: In a playful debate, Sarah argued for monogeny by claiming that all animals secretly share the same great-great-grandparents.
meanings.sent4: The idea of monogeny is like a tree with many branches, all stemming from a single root.
meanings.sent5: Learning about monogeny is like discovering a hidden family tree that connects every living being.

meanings.definition: The theory that all human races have a single origin.
meanings.sent1: Monogeny proposes that all human races can be traced back to a common starting point.
meanings.sent2: Anthropologists explore the concept of monogeny to better understand the shared history of humanity.
meanings.sent3: During a lighthearted discussion, Mark humorously suggested that monogeny means we're all distant cousins.
meanings.sent4: The idea of monogeny paints a picture of humanity as a colorful tapestry woven from a single thread.
meanings.sent5: The theory of monogeny shines a light on the interconnectedness of all people around the globe.
